summary: Right-wing politics believes in maintaining social order and hierarchy, often through tradition, religion, or natural law. It supports inequality as a natural part of society, which can be seen in economic competition. This political view is the opposite of left-wing politics. Right-wingers include social and fiscal conservatives and right-libertarians. The terms "right" and "right-wing" can be used in both positive and negative ways to describe various conservative and neoliberal ideas.
title: Right-wing politics
